DOC.brief_summary: This study test effectiveness `` dry needling '' pain management muscle strength leg function knee pain . Dry needle consists small , monofilament needle administer directly tissue manipulate make muscle relax pain relief . This technique use treat dysfunction skeletal muscle connective tissue help diminish pain , reduce impairment body structure restore function .
DOC.detailed_description: This project evaluate effect dry needle pain , muscle performance , function patellofemoral pain syndrome ( PFPS ) knee . Variables interest include self-reported pain score , self-reported functional outcome disability questionnaire score , various objective clinical measure include muscle strength , joint range motion , movement pattern basic task related activity daily live . Patients refer physical therapy PFPS recruit . Patients randomly equally allocated one follow group : 1 . Gluteal dry needling ( GLUTE ) 2 . Quadriceps dry needling ( QUAD ) 3 . Sham gluteal dry needling ( SHAM GLUTE ) 4 . Sham quadriceps dry needling ( SHAM QUAD ) 5 . Control group ( CONTROL ) Groups 1-4 receive 2 session dry needle sham dry needle gluteal and/or quadricpes muscle painful low limb 2 consecutive week addition standard physical therapy . The CONTROL group receive standard physical therapy . The sham treatment group ( group 3-4 ) receive placebo treatment penetrate skin muscle . Measurements perform baseline prior physical therapy intervention week 3 .
DOC.criteria: 1840 yearsofage Referred physical therapy Presence anterior knee pain around patella ascending/descending stair , squat , and/or run least 3 month . Unable provide consent Bilateral patellofemoral pain syndrome Received previous dry needling treatment Pregnancy History pain le 3 month Imaging demonstrate presence confound internal abnormality ( e.g . chondral defect , ligamentous injury , and/or meniscal pathology ) , History knee surgery Patellar instability Presence neurological condition would affect movement Contraindications dry needle technique ( e.g . history bleed disorder , phobia needle , active cancer diagnosis , presence systemic illness fever sign infection )
